item.title: Strange Times | #savestanfordmvb
item.description: Welcome! First of all, thanks for stopping by. My hope is to post here on a somewhat regular basis, but I can’t make any promises. I guess you’ll just have to keep checking back for updates. Second, I hope you’re doing alright in these strange, coronavirus times. I decided to start this blog for a number of reasons, the most personal of which is to start a journey to the “Kinda Good Island” (in the words of Learner Lab founder Trevor Ragan) of writing/blogging/putting ideas out in the open.

item.title: About Me
item.description: Welcome! My name is Nate Ngo and I am currently the performance analyst for the USA Men’s Indoor National Volleyball Team where I handle video and data analysis. I have been learning and implementing the statistical programming language R since 2016, and am a strong advocate for its use in how we analyze and present information within the sport. In sharing some of my thoughts, processes, and code through this site, I hope to inspire future analysts in the sport of volleyball, and future fans from the data world (and beyond!
